intro: Hiraea bahiensis f. dentulata, commonly known as the Brazilian hiraea, is a rare and unique plant species native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, serrated leaf margins. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its flowering period occurs during the warmer months, producing small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a botanically significant and ecologically important species.
